title: A cockpit, a bakery and a shoe factory: unusual places to spend the night
text:
A cockpit, a bakery and a shoe factory: unusual places to spend the night Published: 12 October 2015 7:53 AM 
A bedroom suite in an airplane cockpit. – AFP/Relaxnews pic, October 12, 2015. To escape the grey and gloomy atmosphere of fall, what could be better than an extended weekend stay in an unusual and quirky location? The HomeToGo vacation rental website has identified a number of surprising accommodation offers all over Europe that are worth the trip. Read on for our top selection. 
An air pilot's cabin in Stockholm, Sweden 
In the Swedish capital, a passenger airplane has been chartered to accommodate tourists in search of a unique nighttime spot. The cockpit has been transformed into a two-person bedroom suite with free WiFi and private bathroom. 
The experience goes for €382 (RM1,795) per night. For those with tighter budgets, a number of other rooms are available throughout the plane at a lower price range. 
A cupcake shop in Paris 
A cupcake boutique in Paris for a unique experience. – AFP/Relaxnews pic, October 12, 2015. In Paris's iconic Montmartre district, a tourist hotspot, the owner of a cupcake boutique rents out her establishment for overnight stays. Lucky guests will stay in a charmingly British setting and will be offered some of the owner's pastry creations during their stay. The 25 sq m space goes for €130 per night. 
An ice castle in Lapland, Finland 
Every winter, the "Snowcastle" is rebuilt to welcome visitors that dream of spending a decidedly unique evening. One night in an ice castle in Finland. – AFP/Relaxnews pic, October 12, 2015. The room is made of ice and can accommodate up to five people. Single rooms and suites are also available and sleeping bags are supplied with each bed. Prices start at €118 per night. 
An old shoe factory in London 
In the British capital, travellers can reconnect with history in this old shoe factory transformed into a holiday location. The 100 sq m loft features authentic architectural elements of the era including hardwood floors and brickwork that emphasise the industrial flair of the space. An old shoe factory converted into a loft for tourists. – AFP/Relaxnews pic, October 12, 2015. 
The spacious apartment comprises a bedroom, balcony, and kitchen and is equipped with a washing machine. A one-night stay will cost you €281. 
A recording studio in Paris 
In the 11th arrondissement of the French capital, a recording studio is available to holiday seekers for couples or friends. A recording studio transformed into a bedroom. – AFP/Relaxnews pic, October 12, 2015. The bed is set in the middle of the studio and guests sleep surrounded by musical instruments and mixing tables. It also includes a bathroom. Prices start at €164. 
A sailboat in Amsterdam 
Anchored on one of Amsterdam's many canals, visitors can rent out this entire sailboat. It includes 11 bedrooms, four bathrooms and can accommodate up to 30 guests. Travellers will have the privilege of visiting the Dutch capital from the water thanks to a tour of the canals. An entire sailboat is for rent on one of Amsterdam's many canals. – AFP/Relaxnews pic, October 12, 2015. The sailboat contains a common room equipped with a television, a stereo system and a draft beer machine. Prices start at €731. – AFP/Relaxnews, October 12,
